label: ABC3_oP20_62_c_a_cd-001
title: Monoclinic Vaterite (CaCO$_{3}$) Structure
comments:
Numerous structures have been proposed for vaterite: (Downs, 2003) lists fifteen.  (Kabalah-Amitai, 2013) found that vaterite consists of at least two coexisting phases: \href{current_web_home_dir/A3BC9_hP26_194_h_a_hk-001}{a disordered hexagonal structure proposed by (Kamhi, 1963)}, and another monoclinic but pseudo-hexagonal phase, shown here. 
  (Meyer, 1960) gave the positions in this structure in the $Pbnm$ setting of space group \#62.  We used FINDSYM to transform this to the standard $Pnma$ setting.  This rotates the coordinate axes around the (111) axis. 
 CaCO$_{3}$ is also found as \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_hR10_167_a_b_e-002}{calcite ($G0_{1}$)}.
